thinking.disposable_income: Kenwood has a mixed-income population with a median household income around $45,000, though there are also affluent areas. About 20% of residents live below poverty line, so transportation costs are significant for many residents
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Significant variation in discretionary spending power across neighborhood. Many residents are price-sensitive to both transit fares and sales tax increases. Higher-income areas have more flexibility in transportation choices
thinking.accessibility: Well-served by CTA buses and Green Line, with good access to downtown. About 35% of residents rely on public transit for commuting. Relatively high car ownership rates compared to surrounding South Side communities. Close to Lake Shore Drive for drivers
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritize balanced policies that maintain transit affordability while improving service quality, given mixed income levels. 2. Lower transit fares preferred due to significant transit-dependent population. 3. Moderate driving fees acceptable as many residents have means to absorb costs. 4. Avoid highest sales tax options due to impact on local businesses and lower-income residents. 5. Selected policies that reduce transit travel times while keeping fares accessible
